// this next line disables the entire HardwareSerial.cpp,
// this is so I can support Attiny series and any other chip without a uart
/* * on ATmega8, the uart and its bits are not numbered, so there is no "TXC0" * definition. */
// Some devices have uart1 but no uart0
// Define ants and variables for buffering incoming serial data. We're
// using a ring buffer (I think), in which head is the index of the location
// to which to write the next incoming character and tail is the index of the

function.name: store_char

unit.comment: // do nothing - on the 32u4 the first USART is USART1
unit.cpp:error: #error "Don't know what the Data Received vector is called for the first UART"

function.name: serialEventRun

unit.comment: // do nothing - on the 32u4 the first USART is USART1
unit.cpp:error: #error "Don't know what the Data Register Empty vector is called for the first UART"

constructor.name: HardwareSerial::HardwareSerial
constructor.parameter_list: (ring_buffer *rx_buffer, ring_buffer *tx_buffer, volatile uint8_t *ubrrh, volatile uint8_t *ubrrl, volatile uint8_t *ucsra, volatile uint8_t *ucsrb, volatile uint8_t *ucsrc, volatile uint8_t *udr, uint8_t rxen, uint8_t txen, uint8_t rxcie, uint8_t udrie, uint8_t u2x)

function.name: HardwareSerial::begin
HardwareSerial::begin
HardwareSerial::end
HardwareSerial::read
HardwareSerial::flush
HardwareSerial::write

unit.decl_stmt: HardwareSerial Serial(&rx_buffer, &tx_buffer, &UBRRH, &UBRRL, &UCSRA, &UCSRB, &UCSRC, &UDR, RXEN, TXEN, RXCIE, UDRIE, U2X);
HardwareSerial Serial(&rx_buffer, &tx_buffer, &UBRR0H, &UBRR0L, &UCSR0A, &UCSR0B, &UCSR0C, &UDR0, RXEN0, TXEN0, RXCIE0, UDRIE0, U2X0);
unit.comment: // do nothing - Serial object and buffers are initialized in CDC code
unit.decl_stmt: HardwareSerial Serial1(&rx_buffer1, &tx_buffer1, &UBRR1H, &UBRR1L, &UCSR1A, &UCSR1B, &UCSR1C, &UDR1, RXEN1, TXEN1, RXCIE1, UDRIE1, U2X1);
HardwareSerial Serial2(&rx_buffer2, &tx_buffer2, &UBRR2H, &UBRR2L, &UCSR2A, &UCSR2B, &UCSR2C, &UDR2, RXEN2, TXEN2, RXCIE2, UDRIE2, U2X2);
HardwareSerial Serial3(&rx_buffer3, &tx_buffer3, &UBRR3H, &UBRR3L, &UCSR3A, &UCSR3B, &UCSR3C, &UDR3, RXEN3, TXEN3, RXCIE3, UDRIE3, U2X3);
